Present location: INSTITUT DE PAPYROLOGIE ET D'ÉGYPTOLOGIE, UNIVERSITÉ DE LILLE III [02/049] LILLE
Technique: FORMED ON THE POTTER'S WHEEL; PAINTED
Name: Bottle
Description: Small bottle with a barely noticeable flat bottom, spherical body, narrow neck and flared lip with a triangular profile. The clay is fine, common and buff-coloured and has been polished. The vessel was covered with a very light brick-red wash, imitating red slipped vessels. Such large models were found in the Middle Kingdom town of Mirgissa/Iken.
